repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Road
            Infrastructure and Safety Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Bosnia and Herzegovina Road
            Infrastructure and Safety Project was rated as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            moderate, and Bank and borrower performance was
            satisfactory. There were eight lessons learned: (1) there
            are important benefits from ensuring that project sites are
            visited before completing appraisal. (2) It is important to
            have separate provisions for physical and price
            contingencies in costing of projects as a tool for dealing
            with cost variations during implementation. (3) Need for
            timely review of procurement thresholds. (4) Programmatic,
            repeater projects help to sustain institutional
            strengthening efforts. (5) Promotional activities, public
            campaigns are important components of road safety
            activities. (6) Exposure to international good practices is
            beneficial. (7) The relevance of covenants should be
            evaluated if they are not implemented.  (8) Baseline
            indicators need to be established in a timely fashion.

15972840.projn: BA-Road Infrastructure And Safety Project -- P100792
15972840.admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
15972840.theme: Infrastructure services for private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Road Infrastructure and Safety Project in
            Bosnia and Herzegovina

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of Road
            Infrastructure and Safety Project in Bosnia and Herzegovina
            was to reduce user costs on the priority sections of the
            trunk and regional roads, to improve road safety, and to
            modernize road maintenance practices. The key results
            achieved were as follows: (a) Out of 241 km of roads to be
            rehabilitated by the project and financed from the IDA
            credit, 61 kilometer have been rehabilitated in the
            Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and 43 kilometer in
            Republika Srpska, which has reduced road user costs; (b)
            There was significant progress with the development of the
            institutional framework for road safety, with the approval
            of entity level road safety strategies, and the
            establishment in the Republika Srpska of a road safety
            agency; and (c) Modernization of road maintenance was
            progressing more slowly, with a pilot output and performance
            based maintenance contract signed in March 2010 in the
            Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

15548846.projn: BA-Road Infrastructure And Safety Project -- P100792
15548846.admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
15548846.theme: Infrastructure services for private sector development

repnme.cdata!: Safer roads in Bosnia and Herzegovina

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about safer
            roads in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Half of the roads in the
            country were in poor shape which led to more bottlenecks and
            also more accidents. Road Infrastructure and Safety Project
            rebuilt about 2,500 kilometers of roads around the country.
            A major bridge spanning the Bosna River that squeezed
            traffic coming in and out of the city was rebuilt which
            saved lots idling time in the car. Significant progress had
            been made to work towards better drivers and safer roads in
            Bosnia and Herzegovina.

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Road
            Infrastructure and Safety Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Road
            Infrastructure and Safety Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina
            are to reduce user costs on the priority sections of the
            trunk and regional road networks, to improve the
            institutional framework for road safety, and to modernize
            road maintenance practices. The closing date extension to
            June 30, 2012 is necessary for the road safety consultancy
            in the Republika Srpska, as delays in procurement mean that
            the contract is expected to be signed shortly and minimum
            contract duration of 11 months is required. No changes have
            been made with regard to implementation agencies, there are
            no outstanding audits and financial management reports are
            satisfactory, and the project is progressing satisfactorily.
            The project objectives continue to be achievable; the
            performance of the borrower and project implementing
            agencies continue to be satisfactory, and the implementing
            agencies have prepared an action plan acceptable to the Bank
            to complete the project.

display_title.display_title:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Road
            Infrastructure and Safety Project : restructuring : Main report
